radiographic_examinations.findings: Heterogeneously enhancing mass arising from the sella with suprasellar extension measuring 8.1 x 37.5 x 10.7 mm.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Repeat MRI at 3.5 months of age showed interval increase in size of the tumor to 9.0 x 31.0 x 12.0 mm; at 10 months of age, the tumor measured 12.5 x 12.5 x 15.1 mm, abutting onto the optic chiasm; by 13 months of age, the tumor had grown to 12.0 x 14.0 x 18.0 mm with mild elevation of the optic chiasm and posterior displacement of the pituitary stalk; at 28 months of age, the MRI showed an area of hypointensity measuring 7.0 x 35.0 x 6.0 mm in the right side of the sella suggestive of possible residual disease, indicating over 95% resection of the overall mass.
